alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, central Bell, Knox, northeastern Whitley and southwestern Clay Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bentley Station, or near Barbourville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Barbourville, Heidrick and King around 600 PM EDT. Yeager, Bimble, Boone Heights, Hinkle and Swanpond around 605 PM EDT. Baughman, Artemus, Brush Creek, Avis, Myrick, Barnyard and Hubbs around 610 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Flat Lick, Old Flat Lick, Himyar, Trosper, Dewitt, Walker, Kayjay, Scalf, Fourmile, Ingram, Wallsend, Blanche, Pineville, Straight Creek, Wasioto, Cary, Arjay, Clear Creek Springs, Rella, East Pineville, Kettle Island and Ferndale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
